neighbors.name: Warren M. Lee
neighbors.claims: Warren M. Lee is a resident of Lee County and the son of Mary Lucia Lee, a long-time local landowner ([SC DHEC Enforcement Report](https://www.des.sc.gov/sites/des/files/docs/Environment/docs/Enforcement/2011/SeptemberReport.pdf)). In 2011, Lee was the subject of a South Carolina DHEC enforcement order regarding the open dumping of solid waste on family property ([SC DHEC Enforcement Report](https://www.des.sc.gov/sites/des/files/docs/Environment/docs/Enforcement/2011/SeptemberReport.pdf)). There is no public record of him holding elected office or taking a public stance on renewable energy development.
neighbors.influence_justification: No public office; history of environmental non-compliance

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with caution given past regulatory history; emphasize how the project ensures professional land management and compliance with all environmental standards.

citations.claim: Warren M. Lee is the son of Mary Lucia Lee and was subject to a 2011 DHEC enforcement order for open dumping.
citations.title: SC DHEC Environmental Enforcement Report September 2011

neighbors.name: Lewis B. Smith & James E. Smith
neighbors.claims: Lewis B. Smith and James E. Smith are brothers and landowners in the region, identified as the sons of the late Thelma Smith of the Mt. Elon Baptist Church community ([The State Obituary](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/thestate/name/thelma-smith-obituary?id=12577517)). Lewis B. Smith has been associated with an address in Florence, SC ([The State Obituary](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/thestate/name/thelma-smith-obituary?id=12577517)). They maintain a low public profile with no documented leadership roles or public statements regarding development.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Smiths through a neighborly, informal approach (perhaps via a mutual acquaintance at Mt. Elon Baptist Church), focusing on how the development will respect their land and farming heritage.

citations.claim: Identified as sons of Thelma Smith with ties to Mt. Elon Baptist Church.
citations.title: Obituary for Thelma Smith

neighbors.name: Douglas Watson Jr.
neighbors.claims: Douglas Watson Jr. is a private landowner residing in the Bishopville area ([Star-News Obituary](https://www.ncgenweb.us/newhanover/obits/sept2008obits.htm)). He appears in local records as a family member of long-time residents, such as Elma Tharp Rooks ([Star-News Obituary](https://www.ncgenweb.us/newhanover/obits/sept2008obits.htm)). No public record exists of him holding civic office or expressing views on land-use planning.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected local farmer or community elder initiate contact, emphasizing how any project plans respect farmland heritage and the long-term legacy of the land.

citations.claim: Listed as a survivor in the obituary of Elma Tharp Rooks in Bishopville.
citations.title: Obituary for Elma Tharp Rooks

neighbors.name: Francine Robinson
neighbors.claims: Francine Robinson (born approx. 1958) is a landowner residing on Dampier Road in Lamar, Lee County ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/r/francine-robinson/)). She is a member of the local Robinson family, with ties to the Hartsville and Lamar communities ([Hines Funeral Home Obituary](https://www.hinesfuneralhome.com/obituaries/Shirley-Thomas?obId=4282437)). There is no evidence of her participation in public zoning hearings or development opposition.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her through a friendly personal visit by a community member she trusts, focusing on preserving the quiet rural character of her land and family legacy.

citations.claim: Francine Robinson resides on Dampier Road in Lamar, SC.
citations.title: Public Record Profile for Francine Robinson

citations.claim: Identified as a family member in the obituary of Shirley Thomas.
citations.title: Obituary for Shirley Thomas
